basics.name: Celia Chavez Virgen
basics.label: Communications and Electronics Engineering Student
basics.summary: Communications Engineer Student passionate about satellite systems and RF technology. Seeking opportunities to grow in the aerospace and telecom industries.

work.name: Agencia Espacial Mexicana
work.summary: Led geospatial analysis for Mexico's first broadband satellite feasibility study, identifying 35,380 disconnected rural localities (1.66M people) to bridge the digital divide.
highlights: Co-authored a Mexico's comprehensive satellite broadband feasibility study.
Revealed $216B MXN cost advantage of satellite solutions over terrestrial deployment.
Developed innovative geospatial models adopted by national policymakers.
responsibilities: Conducted nationwide geospatial analysis of telecom infrastructure gaps using QGIS and Python.
Designed georeferenced system models to visualize broadband coverage limitations in rural areas.
Automated data processing pipelines for telecom infrastructure analysis using Python (GeoPandas, Pandas).
Collaborated with government agencies to validate findings and align with national connectivity goals.
Applied advanced QGIS geoprocessing (buffer zones, route networks) to model 20km coverage areas from fiber nodes.
achievements: Identified 35,380 underserved communities (1.66M people) for satellite connectivity prioritization.
Co-authored landmark national diagnostic report cited by Ministry of Communications (SICT).
Developed cost-comparison models that influenced Mexico's satellite broadband strategy.
Created replicable geospatial analysis framework for future infrastructure projects.

work.name: Samara State Aerospace University
work.position: atellite Mission Analysis & Software Development Research Intern
work.summary: Spearheaded mission design for БРАТЬЯ, a dual-nanosatellite (3U CubeSat) formation in LEO (500 km) to study ionospheric disturbances, optimizing orbital parameters (ΔV = -2.858 m/s, Hohmann transfer) for synchronized data collection.
highlights: Developed innovative low-cost ground station solution (60% cost reduction vs traditional systems).
Achieved optimal orbital synchronization (ΔV = -2.858 m/s) for scientific data collection.
responsibilities: Designed orbital mechanics for 3U CubeSat formation flying in LEO (500km altitude).
Programmed flight software in C/C++ for attitude determination and control systems (ADCS).
Engineered UHF/VHF communication protocols for reliable ground station telemetry.
Prototyped and tested X-Quad antenna system (432 MHz) for signal acquisition.
achievements: Optimized Hohmann transfer parameters achieving 27+ minutes/day ground contact per satellite.
Recognized with 1st Place at PIFI Forum 2024 for research excellence.

Awarded 1st Place at PIFI Forum 2024 (Programa Institucional de Formación de Investigadores) and accepted at CONACES 2024 (Congreso Nacional de Actividades Espaciales de la Agencia Espacial Mexicana).

work.name: Cloud Technologies Center
work.summary: Designed and deployed an IoT energy monitoring system using ESP32 microcontrollers and Arduino Cloud, enabling real-time tracking of air conditioner energy consumption for institutional cost optimization.
highlights: Developed custom 3D-printed enclosures and PCBs to enhance system durability and ensure reliable sensor integration in high-usage environments.
Applied machine learning (K-Means Clustering) to analyze energy datasets, identifying peak usage periods and inefficiencies to reduce operational costs by up to 20%.
Automated data collection and visualization, creating dashboards for actionable insights, improving decision-making for energy-saving initiatives.
Prototyped and tested hardware-software integration, troubleshooting sensor accuracy and connectivity issues for seamless real-time monitoring.

work.name: Fundación Universitaria Los Libertadores
work.summary: Researched and developed innovative solar energy systems, improving conversion efficiency through MPPT algorithms and designed wireless charging for electric vehicles.
highlights: Enhanced solar energy harvesting efficiency through advanced MPPT implementation.
Selected to present research at International Congress of XXVII Summer of Scientific Research.
Developed functional prototype for wireless EV charging using solar integration.

work.name: Extracurricular foreign language courses in Zacatenco
work.summary: Designed and delivered English language instruction at university level, implementing communicative teaching methodologies to enhance student proficiency.
highlights: Implemented innovative assessment techniques to track language acquisition.
Adapted instruction for diverse learning styles in classroom settings.
Planned and executed lesson plans aligned with CEFR standards.

leadership.summary: Improved leadership and soft skills in an international context, demonstrated global project management capabilities.
highlights: Selected as part of the top 5% in the IPN Leaders Training Program.
Achieved C1 English proficiency certified by Oxford Certificate.

projects.name: Emergency Ground Station Network Design and Planning
projects.description: (Ongoing) Design and implementation of an emergency ground station network under the supervision of Dr. Mario Alberto Mendoza Bárcenas using custom-built antennas, radio transceivers, and power measurement tools to ensure reliable communication in disaster scenarios
highlights: Collaborating with amateur radio operators to test and optimize network coverage, improving signal reception and transmission.

projects.name: Olkarion: Nanosatellite Devoted to the Study of the Radio Navigation Field and its Impact in the Mexican Space Sector
projects.description: Developed a CubeSat nanosatellite prototype, to study Earth-Moon cislunar region dynamics, focusing on GNSS communication quality and radio-navigation anomalies.
highlights: Accepted for presentation at the International Astronautical Congress 2024.

projects.name: (Nanosatellite Formation Flying for Ionospheric Research
projects.description: Designed a coordinated nanosatellite formation during my internship at Samara University to boost ionospheric data collection, improving  spatial resolution and adaptive sensing capabilities and analysis for ionospheric dynamics under the supervision of Dr. D.P. Avariaskin.
highlights: Accepted for presentation at the CONACES 2024 and Winner of the 1st place in Poster Category at PIFI 2024.

highlights: Accepted for presentation at the International Congress of the XXVII Summer of Scientific Research Programa Delfin.
